channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2025010833
item.description:
Report X-2025010833

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-20
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Undeclared Hazmat. Leaking box. 2 of 4x1gal metal cans Krylon Weld-Thru Primer Blk K00020103-16 lost 0.7gal from loose lids, no partitions, no paint can clips/ring seals. All contents soiled.

item.title: Report E-2025010208
item.description:
Report E-2025010208

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding crushed boxes with plastic jugs containing hazardous product, Kathon. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallons of product released onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’x4’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 10’x3’ area as a result of improper blocking and bracing. The contractor neutralized the release using vinegar and containerized two empty jugs last containing product along with absorbents, cardboard, pallet pieces, and PPE. One 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2025010811
item.description:
Report X-2025010811

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered with signs of a release at the MEMH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was a single metal drum in a plastic bag. The drum was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025010668
item.description:
Report X-2025010668

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-02
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was found during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained a mechanical part packaged in a plastic bag with styrofoam peanuts for dunnage. A liquid spilled out from the part causing the release. It was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
